intro: Cybianthus sylvaticus, commonly known as the forest aster, is a flowering plant native to the woodlands of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in loose inflorescences, and bloom in shades of purple or pink. Cybianthus sylvaticus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
